replies.body:
I hope they will touch up on his prioritization on his W, it gets frustrating when you get three stacks on the enemy champion and you press W on them and a nearby ally gets eaten instead, and I don't want to bind it to enemy champions only because then I give up the potential of eating an ally when I want to...

Also, give Pantheon his baker skin.
If you press the "~" key you will target enemies only. Its a little tricky to get used to holding that key down in the middle of combat, but you get used to it after a while.
upvote if you looked at your keyboard to find the ~ key
tilde key always under esc
Or you just bind it to a key that you can actually press...

I rebinded mine to the TAB key, so that its right in line with the abilities.

just a friendly tip
How do you see the player builds and w/not then?
Why should Pantheon get his baker skin if Graves can't even have a cigar.
Pantheon doesn't need a baker skin. He's already got nice buns.
so what rito is telling us is that {{champion:76}}  can pole dance but {{champion:104}}  can had a cigar

Instead of pointing out all of the other seductive things that {{champion:76}} does... you just say pole dancing. I mean that sounds like rito is pushing the lines but pole dancing is also used as a form of exercise and isn't always meant for what you think it'd be. I'm gonna get a ton of downvotes...

it gave me the error message.
'so sad you are not authorized" with {{summoner:3}} above it haha. but i had to upvote....

That's an ongoing issues with all abilities like that. I have lost matches where the enemy was right on top of me on lissandra and I ulted myself when clicking on them to ult them. I really wish there was a key override command so that while you're holding that key any abilities that can be cast on enemies and allies will only go off on enemies. Just like the command we already have to force self cast.

Honestly, I don't think they have any kind of intentions of fixing this. I just created a new account to try him out and so on and so on and it seems he's all ready overpowered if played right as it is. (Builds full ap) I noticed that getting stacks was way to easy, going in and hitting the opponent twice without my toungue and then running away to make them chase just a tad bit to use my w to eat them and throw them into the or back at the minions or even my own teammate to finish the kill.
My point being, since i got a little to much into details, I wouldn't look at it as anything to fix but instead look at it as a skillshot which it is. If you were Ahri trying to land your charm, you'd need to position yourself right? Well, Same thing goes for Tahm Kench. 
And it's Tahm for you guys to realize that. (All puns intended)
They should still have a button that makes you only able to target enemies...
Didn't someone say ~ is enemy only....

The problem I actually described has nothing to do with skill, i didn't say if you click on the wrong thing because you messed up. I said if the enemy is standing right on top of you, and your point and click ability works on either, it will often enough be a complete gamble on who it will land on because it casts on the target under the mouse pointer, except you and the enemy are practically on the same spot. 

Melee enemies as a general rule will attempt to stay on top of you some, like fizz, can run through you. So in what way can I use "skill" to make sure the ability goes off on him instead of me? There is a hotkey to force self cast for this reason, so you can make sure it goes off on you if you don't wan it to go off on him. I don't understand why there isn't one to force it on him. It's a basic mechanics issue. It doesn't affect most champs, but on those that it does, like lissandra who I play a lot, it's extremely aggravating.

In the case of Tahm, if an enemy with 3 stacks is standing right on top of an ally, how can you ensure your devour will go off on them and not the ally? You can't.
Look up the [~] key in your keybindinglist. That's the "hostile only" button and will solve your problem.

If you press the "~" key you will target enemies only. Its a little tricky to get used to holding that key down in the middle of combat, but you get used to it after a while.

 Prodigy150  - about 4 hours ago

literally the comment you replied to.

I experienced this the first game I picked him up. Very frustrating. Also when you devour a minion and immediately spit it out it sometimes does 0 damage to the minion and things hit and wont move further then the point at which you can spit your own ally
even with sup titels i still dont get what they r saying
Most likely because you spelled subtitles as "sup titels"

*looks at title*
"oh yea, I guess I'm interested, lets see what they have to say"

*sees its 37 minutes long*
"On second thought, I'm not THAT interested after all..."
_Watches whole thing anyway_

Tanky supports with mustaches.
{{champion:201}}  Kench.
Stand in front of me. (Kappa)
inside*
Tahm, Heart of the Bilgejord.

Meanwhile, in the Kitchen at Riot HQ...

This is where they cook up all the ideas for their new Champions and their juicy kits!

This comment is definitely not in poor taste.
Nice way of adding some flavor to the comments.
you could say he has a spicy personality
Nice pun baking, I think we don't need any salt at all.
League obviously needs more Shokugeki with Master Chef Tahm
as much as i wouldnt like it....Soma Ez would make a yummy skin. and erina lux would even be tastier

If you peel across the lane, the AD becomes extremely juicy and succulent...?

And TF as his dad XD
i dont know any cooking and i didnt want to ruin this chain so umm... PEPPER
The editing of this video was very charming. I felt like I was watching late night Korean television... And that's glorious.
{{champion:223}} vs {{champion:23}} just get three stacks on trynd when he ults then just devour, trynd's ult runs out by the time u spit him up for the kill
Yeah, I was playing as Tahm Kench and everytime we were in a teamfight I'd just destroy him. I kind of felt bad for him.
Cringe-Worthy

It's just a cultural difference in TV production style. A lot of things in many eastern productions are more pronounced, and corny things are quite a bit more commonplace.

Besides, it's not like American productions are all accepted worldwide. I'm sure there's at least a few countries that watch Epic Meal Time and cringe instead of applaud.
I cringe at Epic Meal Time... And I have never left MURICA.

The thing i have learned while playing {{champion:223}} is that his Devour should NOT BE USED TO ATTACK WITH. BAAAAD IDEA while in big team fights, cuz u do that and other people could miss their CC and other attacks. The 32% damage u do to him, it NOT EVER going to be greater than the ADC Blasting him with auto attacks in the time it takes for u to eat and spit out. Save it for the ultimate LCS plays of saving ur ADC to help them kite when they get to pushed forward, I happenn to be a fan of Using my Devour to save my ADC from things like Jinx ult, Fizz Engage, and the like.

Wrong, you're just not using it properly. Basic, Q, Basic, eat and drag the enemy into your teammates. This will do half of a carry's health, if not more, and screw their positioning without them being able to stop it at all. If teammates miss CC because they can't tell you're going to eat the enemy when you sat there and specifically got 3 stacks on the person, then that's them being bad as well.
Bind Tahm to Kalista and he can devour an enemy then pull back to spit into tower range... op.
Riot already said in the Q&A that doesn't work.
lets face it. tahm is over powering. his q needs to be nerfed to where if you stun them the stacks fall off and it takes time to get more stacks on them. kinda like braum
Nah, then he would suck, because the stun woulnd't let him punish enemies. I like how it doesn't consume stacks. It's your fault that he got off his stacks without you doing anything about it.
bibimbap!
Even though he's just been released, I've seen some very amazing plays with him. It's really neat that people are already making the new champ seem OP even though they are just playing smart.
